700765f-b.text:
(1)
City Island Ave. (City Island), west side, south of Rochelle Street, showing the Chateau Laurier. Beers' map of 1868 indicates it to have been the home of S.D. Horton, one of the early settlers of the
island.
July 26, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a complete front view as seen from the dock at
the foot of City Island Ave.
July 26, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, at a later date, as seen from the park in front of the chateau. It is now (1937) the home of the City Island Athletic Club.
July 6, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
700765f-b.original_title: Bronx: City Island Avenue - Rochelle Street
700765f-b.folder: City Island Avenue & Rochelle Street, Bronx, NY

700742f-a.text:
33 to 39 City Island Ave. (City Island), south of, adjoining, and at the S.W. corner of Rochelle Street. (The 1-story shanty, on the extreme right, is at the N.W. corner of the aforementioned street).
July 26, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

Ave.
July 6, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
